args.content:
import Mathlib
open Set Function Filter Asymptotics Metric Complex Bornology
open scoped Topology Filter Real

/-- Suppose z0 âˆˆ â„‚. Show that lim_{zâ†’z0} f(z) = âˆž in the sense of the Riemann sphere if and only if for every M > 0 there exists Î´ > 0 such that |f(z)| > M whenever |z - z0| < Î´. -/
theorem tendsto_riemannSphere_atTop_iff (zâ‚€ : â„‚) (f : â„‚ â†’ â„‚) :
    Tendsto f (ð“ zâ‚€) atTop â†” âˆ€ M > 0, âˆƒ Î´ > 0, âˆ€ z, dist z zâ‚€ < Î´ â†’ M < norm (f z) := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

open Filter Metric
open scoped Topology Filter Real

/-- For f : â„‚ â†’ â„‚, lim_{zâ†’z0} f(z) = âˆž in the Riemann-sphere sense is equivalent to
`Tendsto (fun z => â€–f zâ€–) (ð“ z0) atTop`. This is equivalent to the Îµ-Î´ style condition below. -/
theorem tendsto_norm_nhds_iff_lim_at_top (z0 : â„‚) (f : â„‚ â†’ â„‚) :
  Tendsto (fun z => â€–f zâ€–) (ð“ z0) atTop â†”
    âˆ€ M > 0, âˆƒ Î´ > 0, âˆ€ z, dist z z0 < Î´ â†’ M < â€–f zâ€– := by sorry
